title: Amazing energy and very informative
text: Energetic, creative, fun walking tours! highly recommended for any guided walking tour around the entire area. Very informative and educational. Extra points for spending 2020-2021 providing free online tours via FB, and updates/presentations when the city was closed. Dedicated to their customers -cant wait to follow them in person around Barcelona!!

title: Disappointing
text:
This is my sixth visit or so. All previous visits were tasty and fun.
This time ordered the special dish (beef marinated in silan -date honey)
Took forever to get the dish (we were not told it woll take longer than others), and there was nothing special except overly sweet fried onions on top. Meat was grainy and not soft. Bread was overly crusty. We were two people and left three quarters of the dish. No one asked why (even though we were sitting on the "bar". We had to *ask* for a second knife, and a *clean* fork.
No service at all.
Not adding a photo as tripadvisor does not add points for photos despite advertising so.

title: Perfect street food
text:
For steet food it hits the spot. Great meat. Lovely presentation. A couple of bar seats. Central location in the market. Will return for sure.
Not adding photos as credit not given anyways....

title: Clean, ontime
text:
What else would you need on a flight? Clean chairs and bathroom, accurate take off and landing, efficient crew.
Oh, and available seats to spread out.

title: The idea is exciting but it is quite simple
text: The knowledge and idea of the fact that we walk around historical ruins is exciting itself. But the site is quite bland. It is cool at night to see the juxtaposition of it alongside the contemporary tourists sounds and restaurants.

title: Historical monumental
text: Cant be in Athens for the first time and not see the Acropolis. Apparently one can take a taxi to the top somehow -i wish i knew it. Exhausted myself climbing but took time to stop and enjoy each level. Amazing views. Outstanding artifacts.

title: Stay away
text:
Violated basic trust between hotel guests. Gave my room to a new guest while all my belongings including cloths, passport, money, everything still in the room. I was due to check out the flowing day.
Positive : great location, reasonably priced.

title: Huge impressive museum
text: Huge museum displaying artifacts found during the many excavations up on the Acropolis hill. Very spacious and large galleries. A bit hard to read the labels -one must bend too low. For some reason the evaluators do not stop at each floor and so getting around especially after hours of climbing the actual Acropolis is exhausting. I will have to return one day. Got only a peek.

title: A must. Informative and interesting.
text: Very important historical museum telling the rich story of the jewish community thought out the ages in the various sections of Greece. Includes costumes, religious artifacts, documents, films and more. Such an extensive rich proud history.

title: Informative and educational
text: Small galleries with a lot of items shedding light on history. Heartwarming to see many school kids being educated. Found myself smiling at a stature thousands years old reflecting the same photo i took of myself with a coffee cup that day.

title: Nice collection but a published temp exhibit was actually closed
text: I was told this was the best museum in Athens. It is nice and comprehensive but not the best. Has some lovely pieces and i would definitely check it out next visit. Could be better arranged.

title: A must for Modern Art lovers
text: Newly opened so had no idea what i would see. Loved it. A lovely collection of art. Great spacious display allowing space and respect for each Work. A series of captivating educational films on some of the highlights. Clean. Kind staff. Nice bathrooms, elevators, coat check. A must. Gorgeous.

title: Clean minimalist tastey food
text:
Very impressive kitchen, minimalist food, tiney pita. (i should have ordered two portions). Clean, good taste. I would have preferred if they had a side dish of some tahini or hot sauce to spice things up. I took the pita with some spiced meat and it was very calm....
Lovely serving. Seats outside were heated. Ok bathroom downstairs. Great central location.

title: High prices. Empty place. Average food.
text: I went there in search of a great Moussaka. Arrived towards sunset and was surprised to be the third table sitting for dinner. As time past the two others left. Prices were the highest i saw in Athens. Upside -Dish was large and put in the oven just for me (not a square cut from earlier that day). Truth is there was nothing special about their version. I ate better in NYC and the best in Northern Macedonia. Luckily when i asked to order a salad with it i was told not to. Unusual for someone trying to make a buck but the fish was huge. Next time i will find a place to eat more for less and with better dishes.

title: Just what i needed
text: Great service. Very good and surprising cocktails. Reasonable prices. Only downside was lack of food. Even basic finger food. Amazing music. Felt safe and cozy.

title: Definitely returning. Great food. Great atmosphere. Great prices.
text: Fish, seafood, meat and salads -all fresh, tasty, affordable, and left me with a taste for more. Place closes before 6pm so best for late lunch. Two musicians sang, played instruments, and gave the feeling it was packed even though we were a handful of tables. Best Tzatziki!!! Everything was perfect and i would return in a heartbeat.

title: Favorite for breakfast brunch or lunch
text: Fresh and good dairy or fish options as well as pasta. great coffee. most amazing service. happy to return daily!

title: pre-made dull options
text: arrived at 6pm -our order was taken without informing us that no food was prepared at that time (only that they run out of this and that) -we were given food that had been made earlier in the day so was just terrible.

title: Good satisfying Israeli fusion food
text: Have been treating myself to a monthly burger -and it has yet to fail me. When i ask for the meat to be made medium -that is what i get. The sides are great as well. Fresh and trusted products, kind service. Free parking, quiet atmosphere. Great wine options for when not working...

title: Noisy and inconsistent
text: presented as high end food -some of the dishes were indeed fabulous, but some where nothing special. when we re-ordered the second portion of a good dish, within less than an hour the second we got was half the size of the first! cocktails (4 on the menu and said cannot make any that were not listed) were very disappointing. water took forever. and the service was catered to men only. i am female and sat with 3 men -the waitresses only responded to my male companions. the music (not my taste) was so loud -almost at club level.

title: lovely (yet limited) food
text:
Relatively new Restaurant, off the hidden path, tucked away at the far end of the Inbal Hotel lobby (passed the "all you can eat" soup and bread feast). Staff were very kind. Place quiet so one can hold a real conversation. Food we chose was very tasty, and although the servings were small, with two starters and two main courses and 2 glasses of wine (and, cant lie, i nibbled on one "pita"), we were able to feel full.
We enjoyed the tomato salad ("eggplant" was a spread across the bowl), slices of raw meat (very good!), a kabbab and *amazing* screw of sweetbreads.
I would love to return -but i cant think of anything else on the menu that caught my eye. Main courses came without greens/veg . one must pay for a side-dish -all were carbs. Hoping they transition out of the "temp menu" faze to have a larger variety. all we ate was very well done, served and presented.

title: Great location. Lovely hotel. Luxury hotel with budget prices.
text:
I will get straight to the point:
Pre-arrival airport pickup: Perfect. Driver with sign inside terminal, rate as agreed upon.
Breakfast: huge variety for meat, vegetarian, vegan, children.
Lobby food: great.
Coffee: perfect.
Spa: no Jacuzzi, small circular pool. Lovely resting reclining chairs. Spacious stem room and sauna. extra resting area. Water, darkness, clean bathrooms and showers, lockers. Kind service.
Room: comfortable beds, soaps etc, change of sleepers(!), full wall view yet curtains can dark-out the room, safe, closet, sitting area in basic room, robes upon request, kettle with instant coffee/teas, minibar, daily complimentary water bottles,
Concierge/Check-in/out: efficient and kind
currency change: fair rate

title: off season but lovely to watch
text: beach was clear and empty. all rocks. the sea is just lovely. was a good trip outside Batumi. place is safe and quiet.

title: Lovely spot
text: About 20min out of Batumi, half way towards Sarfi on the Turkish boarder, with 5Lari admission -a lovely fortress with a clean bathroom and amazing huge fruit.signs in English, and benches along the way -a lovely stop.

title: rave reviews but just average
text: every israeli recommended the place. might be nice on the eyes, nothing special to taste. best part was it is cheap so you can try a dozen cakes for price of one in the western world

title: didnt stay
text: the place advertises live music. in actuality the place was full of long tables hosting large families with children running around. the "local" music was a group of a couple of backup playing instruments making unidentified noise. sorry -no room for a couple coming by for dinner and local food.

title: a park
text: one of the series of parks along the shore. clean, nice, places to sit and relax, water and greens (and enough trash cans)

title: Great atmosphere & food
text: By recommendation of friend insisted on eating at this restaurant after picking out our fish at the market, despite other restaurants trying to fish us out. Once you buy your own fish you do not have to pay for them to be grilled, as long as you order side dishes, salads, wine. For four people who left tons on the table the price for 4 salads, a litre of wine, soft drinks, fried, Khachapuri, etc was 100 lari. three fish at the market 50 lari. great tasting food, lovely view, clean, kind.

title: fountain
text: clean and clear -well kept. another city monument. as there are`nt not many, and all are in close proximity -this is a cannot miss.

title: worth the trip
text: lovely waterfall outside the city. the trick is to get a driver to come down from the $100 to 100 Lari (or less) for the trip. 5 minutes from parking lot to the waterfall, so easy access.

title: statue
text: best to read up on local national history, and then when passing the monument you know what you are viewing, as there isn't much of signage there

title: nice spot to meet
text: nothing really to it. both times i passed by there was nothing going on. but it was a great landmark to know on the first day we walked right, on the second -left

title: skip
text: just some contemporary "fake" columns. i was planning on skipping, as i knew they are not ancient, but walking down the blvd you see them anyways

title: closed
text: looks quite out of place and not so "ancient" but more like a contemporary disguised as old. you walk by anyways when on the boulevard...

title: Worth the visit
text: by all means, a lovely way to see the city from above. interesting sites -seeing the grand and beauty alongside the low income housing, and then -nature. Fabulous views from the top.

title: nice
text: short nice fountain "show". less than what i expected. very short, but pleasant. was there at night and it was empty

title: nice day or night
text: Another one of the city squares. despite the redundant name, it is nice to see, and with the clean benches safe atmosphere so can be visited day or night.

title: interesting statue
text: Quite an interesting statue, with a nice tale. not as "kitch" as i initially suspected, and actually interesting to watch.

title: clean, clear, nice walk
text: sites and benches everywhere. all clean and pleasant. long nice walk not far from the shore. playgrounds for kids and various attractions for adults.

title: Perfect atmosphere, food and prices
text: Visited with three friends (a lot of pressure on me as i chose the place based on TripAdvisor...) and we all loved the place. My companions were vegetarian, so chose salads: avocado, eggplant and Georgian; Khachapuri, soup, and Mexican potatoes. I enjoyed the Borscht which was AMAZING, and the Quail. The Khachapuri was quite big -we divided it in four, and each had several bites. good house wine. clean restaurant. kindest service. great prices.

title: Efficient. recommended.
text:
Took a "low cost" flight to Thessaloniki en-route to Macedonia, and the flight was barely half full. The staff were kind and inviting. the seats were clean. both outbound and return was provided with a chose of beverage (apple/orange) juice / coffee/ tea / water / etc, as well as a power/health cookie which was perfect.
on the way back the bathrooms were disgusting immediately after take-off so i cant believe they were cleaned at Thessaloniki airport. plane was fuller then, but i was seated at row 1 and it was great to stretch out my legs.

title: As far as local hotels go this is ok
text: Easy accessible location. Right on the lake with chairs and best view. My room was first floor facing the syreet (right on top of entrance) so i was able to avoid the small elevators and had a bath but got now view and had the street sounds. Breakfast and dinber were boring repetative and quite tasteless. The woman makung eggs in the am was great so i stuck to eggs. At dinner the fish saved the day.website claimed there was a 10E/day spa. Thete is none. Grocery across the street. Everything there is to do or see in the town is walking distance. Reception kind and provided reasonable currency change. Rooms do not get cleaned just garbage removed towels changed and bed straightened out. No vacuum or wiping not even toiletries or washing of cups.

title: Perfect experince
text: It took me a month after the passing of Nava Bibi, the mythological matriarch of Piccolinno and its predecessor Little Jerusalem, to enter the restaurant. Filled with a heavy heart and tears, i walked in to find the place alive, festive, and on the highest standards. The band playing shared a wide range from Michael Jackson to Elul prayers. After 10pm most tables were taken. The waiters gave their full attention, and the kitchen supplied outstanding food. The Tuna Burger was amazing -perfectly done, with a full salad and fried potatoes wedges -five kinds of Aïoli Highly recommended!

title: refreshed menu
text: been visiting for decades. always a winner, both for quiet dinning and for family get togethers. friendly staff, fresh good food. will be returning again. and again.

title: tasty, calm, fun
text: Perfect location for both local residents and visitors, the tapas / chef small restaurant is open on Shabbat. reservations are the safest, but even without you will probably get a spot on the bar for an hour or so. We were disappointed this time in the pork ribs (and the attempt of the waiter to explain it away by assuming we didnt have this dish or pork meat in the past is not very polite). sausage was OK. highly recommended was a fresh dish of the day -a version of shrimp ceviche with oranges. wow. and the cocktails were very very good.

title: Lovely hotel and waterfront
text:
great about the hotel: high quality and huge variety of food at the buffet breakfast and dinner. unlimited and large beach/spa towels. spacious waterfront. wonderful clear water/sea. the hotel gave complimentary in the room a mud bag, 2 water bottles, use of robes. lots of staff everywhere cleaning, assisting etc. several conference rooms. basic room had sea view.

problematic: smoking is allowed everywhere on the beach and by the pool. there should be a smoke-free zone, or a limited smoking area. and the lifeguard should definitely not smirk/laugh at me when i ask if there is a smoke-free area. finish sauna should have wooden floors that are slip-proof. (was terrible to watch a gentleman walk down the bench and slip on his back into the heater. Spa should be/have a cellphone / children free zone. ridiculous having grownups and kids having speakerphone conversations or watching movies while the intention of a spa is peace and quiet. bathroom doors should be vision and sound proof -glass sliding doors provide no privacy. each slightest sound is heard in the room and if someone sleeps it wakes them. room should be able to be dark. sun comes up very early, and the lights from outside shine in all night. i got no sleep. many of the staffers knew no English and/or Hebrew -so hard to communicate. no enough showers on the beach or clear water sauce. bathrooms on the beach close midday (and open late in the morning). Spa has only 2 (glass door) toilets for females (i can only assume same for males). location: far from the "mall" and other eateries and shopping center.

title: Soothing views. basic amnesties.
text: Treated myself to a birthday of watching waves. Filled up my heart and soul. Would have been better if showers/bathrooms/drinking water were more accessible.

title: casual Mexican -hits the spot each time
text: Traveled all the way from Jerusalem to Tel Aviv as was craving Mexican for my birthday. Had the shrimp tacos -was generous and delicious. Companion had a vegetarian taco at it too was generous and good. Couldn't resist the Nachos, even though they didn't have a "half size" dish. Obviously we finished it all. very generous and reasonably priced. Only downside was the cocktails -very weak and tasted like they used preserved lemonade and not real lemons (aside from the garnish). Service was suitable to a fast-food joint: despite my repeated questions about the strength of the Margarita -no one came to ask if i enjoyed it, or if another shot needed. and: despite my companion telling them we were celebrating my birthday, and myself telling them we traveled for over an hour -no drink/dish "on the house" given. That could have been nice. Regardless -i will return.

title: Simple with a twist
text: Lovely minimalist wine bar in a central yet quiet Tel Aviv location. Reasonably priced even if small portions. Interesting combinations on familiar dishes. Downside was the bathroom which is not clean and although it's decor is of a special eatery the cleanliness is of a public restroom. Also, two dishes ordered for two people and served over ten minutes apart so that the first dish (middle eastern calamari on a bed of tomato seads with hot peppers) cooled off and list some of it's charm by the time the foccacita with artichoke arrived. Lemonade was watered fown. Chardonnay was perfect. Aside from recommending dishes be served together I would be easier on the cutoff for happy hour. We arrived a couple of minutes before 8pm, by the time we were sat and a waiter came for our order it was 4 past 8pm and could not get the % off...I would be returning to try other dishes.

title: Perfect food and atmosphere
text: Was craving some wine and dinner. Piccolino has a new improved and innovative menu. Worth a repeated visit. The Artichoke Ravioli is to die for. The background music is magical. Service impeccable. Love love this place.

title: Not too bad. Lovely setting
text: Stopped by for spontaneous late dinner so shared an eggplant salad and Shakshuka (not typically Italian) either a friend. Each had her own glass of wine. Portions were not generous but food satisfying. Side of salad was small bowl of greens and a cherry tomatoe cut in half. Tahini serving was spoon size, but we added for and got a second. Will probably return to try the real Italian dishes.

title: Huge selection of creative pizzas. And salads
text: Great and huge selection of pizzas. Very creative and filling. Reasonable prices. Several salads too for those in fear of carbs. Vegen options. Fun atmosphere and great for a family or friends get together.

title: Hits the spot each time
text: Was desperately looking for a place to feed a hungry for a burger kosher pre-teen, on a national holiday. The service was efficient, the burger according to the kid was tastey. The dish came with a side of juicy fries (he shared them with me), and he left with a smile. Been there before and will be returning when in the area.

title: Extremely disappointing
text: Small portions, even for tapas. No connection between description in menu and actual dish. Bartenders with attitude though you cannot order at the bar without communicating with them, or understanding the menu. No drinks menu, so again, all by talking to bartenders and up to what they say is available. Two different dishes (fish/meat) came in same dressing and spices....!) Did however enjoy one of the drinks.

title: Disappointing. After many years of enjoyment.
text: Haven't been there in a year, and looks like there have been changes. Menu has been significantly downsized. Service was almost non existent. Got our coffees within minutes and the espresso was great. Waited for a Caprese salad for half an hour only to get an ice cold dish that had four ingredients recently pulled out of the fridge. While waiting for the food almost fainted asked for a bite of bread, they put in an order for a full load which arrived after the food. Companion ordered a traditional meat on bread dish. The bread was pizza like thin, on a metal platter that has seen better days. Nothing special about the taste. Each attempt at slicing was a challenge. No one came to check on us. No water till the half hour mark. Used to be my go to place. Not anymore.

title: Can't be in Belgrade without visiting
text: A definite must. Very interesting both as a historical location and essential to understanding the city and as a lovely place to stroll and enjoy several peaceful hours. Visited twice in a three day vacation. Many

title: Huge disappointment. Terrible service.
text: We ordered three dishes. The biggest starter for two -bruscata with meats and cheeses. Got billed for the bread separately. When we asked about it the shift manager made a spit noise on us. First took an hour to get food. No apologies. No discount. No freebees. No samples. Alcohol was tasteless and low %. The other two dishes were oven baked stews meat with mashed potatoes. One was ok. One great. Still lost appetite and returned most of the food. No one cared or asked what was wrong. We asked about food status several times. Was told there was an issue with the pizza oven. Never ordered pizza. Shameful. Pictured is the only thing served for the first hour. Bread arrived with the stater not as part of it. SKIP IT!!!

title: Great value for money. Lovely 4+ star hotel
text: Haven't been to other five star hotels in Belgrade so can't compare but this seems to cover most bases. Spa can be improved if semi size pool was heated, and jacuzi had more than four water spouts. Both should have non slip steps. Steam room ok and dry sauna was clean and spacious. Breakfast had huge variety but veggies old. Rooms spacious but we could hear our neighbors. Staff very accommodating especially bellboys and concierge. Bar was lovely too.
place: Metropol Palace, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Belgrade

title: huge disappointment
text: For starters: the street is so short, and nothing was going on outside except people trying to draw us in. The place is so noisy with two "local" bands playing in two adjunct rooms -you cant understand anything. We asked for the local meat pattie that looks like a hamburger with cheese inside -got a plate load of kababs. the chicken dish was disappointing too. we left more than half of each dish. no one came to see if we are happy. Barely any service. food just fat with no real taste.

title: A must!!! best value ever for amazing food!
text: We took the "food train" at the lunch rate a minute before the dinner rate kicked in, and it was work every dinar and then some. The quality of the dishes, the variety, the taste, the service (SANDRA was AMAZING!!!!), the cleanliness (yes -bathrooms too!) the atmosphere -even the background music: all was just fabulous. If i was a local i would be going there all the time. They were very generous. The dishes were incredible, unique, original, fresh, pure delight. Only downside was the alcohol -very weak and smallest portions. A must if you in Belgrade.

title: Five Stars all the way
text: Putting aside the fact that the rates throughout the city are lower than in the USA and Europe, the food was spectacular. The service, the cleanliness, even the toilets were five stars. The presentation of the food was as spectacular as the taste. When i asked my steak say "moo" before it hit the plate (i like it rarer than blue) the waiter gave me regards from the cow. It was to die for. amazing food. Great wine and cocktails. I would return in a heartbeat.

title: Worth the return visit
text: I havent visited in about three months and was happy to see the restaurant refreshed the salad served as starters (free with a main course), got new dishes (lovely pottery), and some new items on the menu. the starters were refilled as many times as we wanted and the bread was a refreshing change (compared to the one they have been serving past couple of years). My friend took the beef filet which is always a winner. i tried the "platter" of 3 pieces of filet fish, and frankly was slightly disappointed with the portion size, the amount of oil (was supposed to be grilled, but has too much oil) and the fact that one piece was full of bones. but it was lovely. we were not pushed to leave even 2 hours after eating, and the atmosphere was great. i recommend asking for a table by the window on top floor to avoid the fish smell of the lower floor when the place full. and make a reservation in advance.

title: Ok basic
text: It's the only establishment in the area that serves food with tables and waiters so it does get a slow and calm amount of visitors. The lunch special includes a soup (choice of 3) and most main courses. Minestrone was a bit watery and had no been, pasta, etc. Small but sufficient portion. For the main course I took the eggplant parmesan and it was 2 thin layers of slightly bitter eggplant with cheese over under and around. I was warned plate hot, which quite was but did not have to wait for dish to cool. Sauce was on the sweet side. Food was served in perfect timing but it has been over 15 minutes since my last bite and no one cleared table / offered espresso/dessert or asked if I wanted anything or the check. I'm not even sure the business lunch includes anything else. Asked for water and graded parmesan for soup separately (had to go in to find a waiter to ask). I guess ok for a neighborhood place. They hold events as well. (Might be busy setting up)

title: Right to te point. Fish.
text: Nit the first visit there. Nit the last (although prices up). Limited menu in a good way. The have selected whole fish on the grill all same price,side dish of veggies or fries. Generous selection of 6-8 tapas salafs with fresh warm bread as a free starter with full ordered meal. All made perfectly well. Nuce full portion. Lovely lively location in Machane Yehuda Shuk. Wine and beer. Perfect dinner.

title: Gorgeous monument
text: Beautiful historical site which is a must for a Lisbon visit. The entire waterfront and site should not be missed.

title: Limited menu and attitude
text: 3 nights after visiting here i found out there is a row of intetesting and exciting restaurants on the waterfront. If i knew in advance would have skipped this place. Got quite the attitude from the staff when my companion and i were able to figure out that if we lay a finger on the plates they placed on the table while we read the menu we would be charged for all. I ordered a loveley dish but it included half liter of oil. I asked and got a second plate and spent a while transferring all items to clean plate. Octopus was perfect. So were the al dente veggies but price did not include a glass of tap water, attention from waiters or an extra napkin. Too bad.

title: great simple clean food
text: after walking around the mall too much had dinner: the Quiche and soup deal and it was great -fresh, clean, and for under a euro added coffee and water. great deal.

title: Worth the ride
text: for just 4e you get to see the city and waterfront from above. was gorgeous -took tons of pictures, enjoyed seeing all i walked in minutes

title: has enough stores to keep anyone happy
text: Free WiFi, clean bathrooms, full of stores and a supermarket. Food court with everything. nicely kept.

title: Just a food court
text: looked like tourists and pickpocketers there. just a "luxurious food court". I walked in and out, didnt stay to eat.

title: Lovely hotel; nice location
text: Ricardo the night manager, and Ricardo the day concierge, and the lovely omelet lady at breakfast, and the rest of the staff -where very kind and helpful. Rooms clean and spacious, breakfast filling, GREAT coffee in the rooms and at breakfast. Easy walking to waterfront and restaurants, Vasco Mall, and many other attractions. One downside was the train station -i heard the last train after 1am and the first at 5am from the 14th floor. Understood the pool and spa were great (from a friend traveling with me who made the right choice to not get dragged along to the mall and actually relax).

title: Lovely dishes and atmosphere
text: Very interesting and generous dishes with unique twists. Both small tapas and full main courses are on the menu. Alcohol menu available including cocktails. Inside and outside seating as well as bar. Open late and take reservations. Meat, pasta, seafood and more.

title: Best seafood meat restaurant in jerusalem
text: This is hands down my favorite restaurant. Food so exciting and good I never seem to take photos.... Been visiting for two decades, and will continue coming back. We try and celebrate family milestones and just life there several times a year. Worth the money. Staff kind and attentive yet not over baring. If you advise them of an event being celebrated they will pamper with a desert. During the last visit they accommodated our large group with last minute challanges with effeciency and smiles. Fresh well seasoned food. A must if you looking for good non kosher food in Jerusalem. absolutely love it there. Can't wait to return.

title: OK but better options down the street
text: i find i go there when my company requires extra Kosher certificate. the portions are not too big compared to prices and other places, space tight, service could use improvement, and for years now they have a coffee machine that requires ridiculous loud banging on a metal surface. no idea why they cant replace it with silicon or something. i might shoot the barista next time.

title: Large portions, nice reliable place
text: been going there every couple of months. food basic -they try to make it interesting, but not to spicy or adventurous -i think they expect families mostly. floor and tables could have used cleaning during the day, and the AC was ridiculously low -even after people complained.

title: the new BAR at Hansen House -got lots of potential
text: The Hansen House just opened a new bar. There were not too many food options, but the "Challah and Tapas" we tried was lovely, interesting, fresh, and the two of us did not finish the entire large size serving. the music was lovely -went from light 1970s to fun 1980s; later in the evening (11pm?) turned Israeli and nosier, but the earlier hours were fun. mature crowd -bot no interaction between parties that i saw (a downer). As limited cocktails and food didn't give it a 5*. looking forward to returning when they pick up. fun additional alternative to the area.

title: Complete turnaround. Great food.
text: Having been at Smadar several times at it's many previous incarnations, i must say the newst is the best to date. Interesting satisfying dishes with top notch presentation. Reason im not giving it the full five stars is it a bit pricey. You should order several dishes to share as they more tapas style, and it adds up. Also we were recommended a drink after dinner, having enjoyed the pre dinner cocktails allowed staff to introduce us to a new drink. Was one of the worst i ever had to down and when bill came was like an 18yr single malt. So. Just check prices first....

title: A must for first or only day in the city
text: Conceived in the old city, born and raised in the New, i visit the walled in area several times a year. It never gets OLD. Sights sounds smells music. All there. Whether you atheist or a monotheist believer, the city has an undeniable charm and sacred feeling.

title: Worth revisiting. So much more than just the memorial
text: Visited numerous times over decades. Personally felt more connected via the old version of the memorial museum. But. Returned last week to see the temporary photography exhibition and the art exhibition. These both stack up against any art exhibition and photography one. Beautifully done. Fascinating material. Wow. Powerful beyond words. And the breathtaking sunset while exiting just gave us hope.
place: Yad Vashem - The World Holocaust Remembrance Center

title: great getaway
text: for maybe my seventh time in 2 years, and over dozens in the past 20 years -i got away from the regular troubles of work and the city, and awarded myself a brief stay at my favorite Dead Sea Hotel. The staff seems to be stably employed and that is a good sign. the rooms are spacious and provide kettles, minibars and the other basics. the renovated rooms no longer have baths -but truth is you spend most your time soaking in the Dead sea or the Spa... the trick is to find the quiet hours in the facilities. it gives me a sense of "home away from home". very kind staff. good food. lovely Spa. best beach. I will be going back within months.
